oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lefaucheux revolver from Johnsonville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: French-made 6-shot nonpercussion revolver with two rounds in the chamber. Dug at the Upper Redoubt in the Federal fortifications at Johnsonville State Historic Park. A military issue sidearm often associated with Midwestern cavalry units, possibly the 8th Iowa Cavalry, which was at Johnsonville at the time of Gen. Nathan B. Forrest's attack on November 4, 1864.
